; Mon, 16 Oct 2023 21:55:03 +0800 Funeral for Chicago-area Palestinian boy killed by landlord to be heldhttps://reuters.com/article/usa-crime-muslim/funeral-to-be-held-for-chicago-area-muslim-boy-killed-in-attack-idUSKBN31G15P
;;2023-10-16T13:44:54Z;
;;
;;Wadea Al-Fayoume，6 岁，一名穆斯林男孩，据警方称，他在一次针对他和他母亲的袭击中被刺死路透社于 2023 年 10 月 15 日获得的一张未注明日期的家庭照片，展示了他们的宗教信仰，也是对以色列和哈马斯之间持续冲突的回应。CAIR/来自 REUTERS/File Photo 的讲义;
;

;A一名六岁穆斯林男孩被刺伤后，将于周一在芝加哥郊区举行葬礼和埋葬。 -muslim-boy-2023-10-15/">;周末被一名男子刺死;，该男子针对他和他的母亲，因为他们是巴勒斯坦裔美国人。

;

;为男孩提供的服务，根据美国伊斯兰关系委员会 (CAIR) 的一份声明，该活动定于下午 1:00（格林尼治标准时间 1800）在芝加哥西南部伊利诺伊州布里奇维尤的清真寺基金会举行，名为 Wadea Al-Fayoume。

;

;“这是一个沉重的日子，我们希望永远不会到来。正如他们所说，最小的棺材是最重的，”CAIR-Chicago 执行董事艾哈迈德·雷哈布 (Ahmed Rehab) 在声明中说道。

;

;葬礼将在一个因当地的“小巴勒斯坦”而被称为“小巴勒斯坦”的社区举行。巴勒斯坦裔美国人严重集中。

;

;这次杀戮发生在新的中东;危机之中;，继一周前哈马斯武装分子对以色列平民发动残酷袭击以及随后的;以色列在哈马斯控制的加沙地带进行报复;。

;

;这场冲突让美国的犹太和巴勒斯坦穆斯林社区紧张不安，担心潜在的危险周六，这名 6 岁男孩和他的母亲（被确认为 32 岁的 Hanaan Shahin）在西南约 40 英里（64 公里）处的普兰菲尔德镇遭到房东的袭击芝加哥。男孩被刺 26 刀，而他的母亲则多处受伤。她有望活下来。

;

;嫌疑人约瑟夫·祖巴 (Joseph Czuba)，71 岁，被指控犯有一级谋杀罪、一级谋杀未遂罪、两项仇恨犯罪罪以及使用致命武器严重殴打罪，威尔县警长办公室表示。

;

;“侦探们能够确定，这起残暴袭击中的两名受害者都是嫌疑人的目标，因为他们都是穆斯林，而且中东冲突持续不断，涉及哈马斯和以色列，”威尔县治安官办公室在一份声明中表示。

;

;司法部长梅里克·加兰周日晚些时候表示，美国司法部将对这起袭击事件展开联邦仇恨犯罪调查。

;

;“这一事件无济于事但进一步加剧了我国穆斯林、阿拉伯和巴勒斯坦社区对仇恨引发的暴力的恐惧，”声明中写道。 “美利坚合众国的任何人都不应该因为他们的崇拜方式或他们或他们的家人来自哪里而不得不生活在暴力的恐惧之中。”

;

;在刺伤事件发生之前，没有任何值得注意的问题或已知的问题CAIR 表示，Czuba 与家人之间存在冲突。据该组织称，Czuba 在袭击过程中大喊“你们穆斯林必须死”。

;

;路透社无法确认 Czuba 的律师身份。他在遗嘱中治安官办公室称，县监狱正在等待他首次出庭。

; Mon, 16 Oct 2023 21:55:03 +0800 US Supreme Court turns away appeal in PETA undercover recording casehttps://reuters.com/article/usa-court-undercover/us-supreme-court-turns-away-appeal-in-peta-undercover-recording-case-idUSKBN31G16A
;;2023-10-16T13:52:44Z;
;;
;;2023 年 10 月 4 日美国华盛顿的美国最高法院大楼。REUTERS/Evelyn Hockstein/File Photo;
;

;美国最高法院周一拒绝听取北卡罗来纳州对一项州法律的辩护，该法律旨在防止隐藏摄像头调查损害农场和其他企业，以应对善待动物组织提出的挑战(PETA) 和其他动物权利组织。

;

;法官驳回了北卡罗来纳州民主党总检察长乔什·斯坦 (Josh Stein) 和代表北卡罗来纳州农民的贸易协会对下级法院裁定 2015 年法律违反美国宪法的上诉。第一修正案的言论自由权针对“新闻采访活动”。

;

;善待动物组织表示，它进行秘密调查，揭露实验室、农场和屠宰场、宠物贸易、服装行业和其他领域虐待动物的情况。该组织表示，它希望对北卡罗来纳大学的动物测试实验室进行秘密调查，但担心州法律会威胁赔偿金钱。

;

;PETA、动物联盟防御基金和其他五个组织2016 年向联邦法院提起诉讼，要求阻止该法律的执行，称该法律惩罚了举报人的言论自由。

;

;该法律允许企业或业主起诉进行秘密录音或删除信息的“双重间谍”工人来自非公共领域的文件，并利用这些信息“违反个人对雇主的忠诚义务”，以追偿违规行为的金钱赔偿。

;

;原告和批评者称该措施是多项“ag”措施之一全国各地的法律旨在限制动物权利活动人士的秘密行动。以斯坦为代表的该州表示，该法律将保护所有雇主免受各种伤害，例如员工未经授权使用商业秘密、竞选策略或患者信息。

;

;总部位于弗吉尼亚州里士满的公司美国第四巡回上诉法院二月份裁定，该法律在针对“新闻采访活动”（例如善待动物组织和其他原告所追求的活动）执行时违反了第一修正案。斯坦因告诉法官们，“新闻采集者没有第一修正案的权利来违反普遍适用的法律”，例如禁止非法侵入。

;

;左翼和右翼的各种激进组织都会进行秘密调查，旨在揭露不法行为，有时是为了揭露不当行为。被指控有选择地编辑视频以使他们的拍摄对象变坏。

;;
;;2023 年 9 月 28 日，交易员在美国纽约市纽约证券交易所 (NYSE) 的交易大厅工作。 REUTERS/ Brendan McDermid/档案照片;
;

;华尔街主要股指周一开盘走高，投资者等待本周关键经济数据和主要企业盈利，以获取有关美国经济的线索，同时也在关注以色列与哈马斯冲突。

;

;随着美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯在高层会议结束后抵达以色列进行会谈，美国努力防止紧张局势升级，长期美国国债收益率上涨world/middle-east/conflict-middle-east-could-escalate-us-national-security-adviser-warns-2023-10-15/">;美国官员警告;冲突可能会恶化。

;

;以色列继续;轰炸加沙; 在安排停火的外交努力失败后，哈马斯统治的加沙居民表示夜间空袭是迄今为止最猛烈的一次，据信以色列即将发动地面进攻。

;

;标准普尔 500 指数和纳斯达克指数 ;周五下跌;，因消费者信心数据恶化和中东冲突令投资者望而却步来自风险较高的押注，并掩盖了美国大型银行的一些乐观收益。

;

;“（投资者）实际上不那么紧张了……现在的讨论是试图遏制这种情况，不要让它扩大到新泽西州查塔姆 Themis Trading 合伙人兼联合创始人乔·萨卢齐 (Joe Saluzzi) 表示：“如果是这种情况，市场也会接受。”

;

;“收益将为我们提供良好的指示。我们处于经济周期的哪个位置，我们是否应该真正担心经济衰退。”

;

;大型银行高盛的结果 ;(GS.N);，美国银行 ;(BAC.N);，摩根士丹利;(MS.N)< /a>;，制药巨头强生 ;(JNJ.N);，电动汽车制造商特斯拉 ;(TSLA.O); 和视频流先驱 Netflix ;(NFLX.O); 将于本周发布。

;

;第三季度收益LSEG 数据显示，标准普尔 500 指数公司预计年增长率为 2.2%。

;

;在已公布业绩的 32 家标准普尔 500 指数公司中，87.5% 的业绩超出预期，远高于长期平均水平66.5%。

;

;投资者还在本周晚些时候等待经济数据，包括 9 月零售销售和 10 月费城联储商业指数。

;

;数据显示纽约联储“帝国州”指数，根据当前商业状况衡量纽约州制造业活动的指标，10 月份跌至 -4.60，而预期为 -7。

;

;费城联储主席帕特里克·哈克 (Patrick Harker) 将于当天晚些时候发表讲话，而美联储主席 < a href="/markets/us/feds-powell-faces-what-me-worry-moment-spiking-bond-yields-war-political-2023-10-16/">;杰罗姆·鲍威尔;是由于周四发表讲话。

;

;哈克周五表示，他认为美国央行;加息周期可能已经结束;。

;

;芝加哥联储主席;Austan Goolsbee;表示，“不可否认”美国通胀放缓是一种趋势，而不是暂时现象据一份报告称。

;

;截至美国东部时间上午 8:43，道指 e-minis 上涨 185 点，即 0.55%，标准普尔 500 e-minis 上涨 19.25 点，即 0.44%，纳斯达克 100 指数上涨e-minis 上涨 40.25 点，即 0.27%。

;

;Nvidia ;( ;路透社报道;美国将采取措施阻止美国芯片制造商向中国出售半导体，以阻止更多人工智能芯片出口。

;

;;辉瑞; ;(PFE.N); 周五将全年收入预测下调 13%，股价下跌 0.3%。竞争对手 Moderna ;(MRNA.O); 下跌 4.4%。

;

;Lululemon Athletica ;(LULU.O); 上涨了 6.0%，因为这家运动服装制造商将于本周加入标准普尔 500 指数，取代动视暴雪 ;(ATVI.O);.

;

;;雅宝; ;(ALB.N); 在全球最大的锂化学品制造商撤回其拟议的 ALB 计划后，该公司股价上涨 2.1%出价 66 亿美元（41.6 亿美元）收购澳大利亚锂生产商 Liontown Resources ;(LTR.AX);.

; Mon, 16 Oct 2023 21:25:03 +0800 Sam Bankman-Fried needs more Adderall to focus at trial, lawyers sayhttps://reuters.com/article/usa-bankmanfried/sam-bankman-fried-needs-more-adderall-to-focus-at-trial-lawyers-say-idUSKBN31G133
;;2023-10-16T13:14:54Z;
;;
;;FTX 前首席执行官 Sam Bankman-Fried 因加密货币交易所破产而面临欺诈指控，他在曼哈顿听证会后离开美国纽约市联邦法院，2023 年 1 月 3 日。路透社/Andrew Kelly/档案照片;
;

;萨姆·班克曼-弗里德 (Sam Bankman-Fried) 需要更高剂量的阿得拉 (Adderall) 来集中精力进行欺诈审判并决定是否他的律师表示，他将为自己辩护。

;

;班克曼-弗里德的律师在周日晚些时候致美国地区法官刘易斯·卡普兰 (Lewis Kaplan) 的一封信中表示，一剂 Adderall FTX ;加密货币交易所创始人;每天清晨都会被送进监狱，以治疗他的注意力缺陷多动症，他的注意力缺陷多动症逐渐消失审判日开始的时间。

;

;“当我们接近辩方案件以及班克曼-弗里德先生是否出庭作证的关键决定时，辩方越来越担心，因为班克曼-弗里德先生缺乏他的律师写道：“在服用阿得拉后，他无法像平常那样集中注意力。”

;

;自他因;盗窃数十亿美元的 FTX 客户资金于 10 月 3 日在曼哈顿联邦法院拉开序幕，Bankman-Fried 被目击在作证时，他在笔记本电脑上打字，并向律师低声说话。

;

;检察官指控这位 31 岁的前亿万富翁在明星作证时大笑;证人卡罗琳·埃里森;，他的阿拉米达研究对冲基金的前首席执行官和前女友。他的律师马克·科恩 (Mark Cohen) 称这项指控“荒谬”。

;

;班克曼-弗里德 (Bankman-Fried) 对与 ;FTX 于 2022 年 11 月崩盘;，声称虽然他在运营交易所时犯了错误，但他并没有偷钱。< /p>;

;检察官表示，他们最快可能在10月26日休庭。美国刑事案件中的被告没有义务出示证据，出庭作证可能会面临检察官盘问的风险

;

;但是班克曼-弗里德违背了白领被告基本保持沉默的传统做法。他在 2022 年 12 月 12 日被捕一个月后发表了博客文章，并向《纽约时报》的一名记者分享了埃里森的私人著作。

;

;卡普兰表示，这可能相当于 8 月 11 日篡改证人，并将他还押候审。布鲁克林大都会拘留中心。

;

;班克曼-弗里德的律师在信中建议，在他每天早上前往法院之前，给予他 12 小时缓释剂量的阿得拉。他们说 MDC 的律师没有回复他们的电子邮件或电话。

;

;管理 MDC 的联邦监狱局没有立即回复置评请求。

; Mon, 16 Oct 2023 21:25:03 +0800 Qatar helping four Ukrainian children go home from Russia, seeks to recover morehttps://reuters.com/article/ukraine-crisis-children-qatar/qatar-helping-four-ukrainian-children-go-home-from-russia-seeks-to-recover-more-idUSKBN31G0D5
;;2023-10-16T13:15:15Z;
;

;根据多哈与双方合作建立的新机制，卡塔尔本周将帮助四名乌克兰儿童从俄罗斯返回家园一名卡塔尔官员周一对路透社表示，计划在未来更多地返回乌克兰。

;

;一名 7 岁男孩在卡塔尔莫斯科大使馆与祖母团聚后，于周一经爱沙尼亚返回乌克兰卡塔尔官员上周表示。该官员称，周一，一名两岁男孩也被移交给莫斯科的卡塔尔外交官，一名 9 岁男孩和一名 17 岁女孩将于本周晚些时候移交。< /p>;

;基辅已确认有 20,000 名儿童在未经家人或监护人同意的情况下被带到俄罗斯或俄罗斯控制的领土，称其为符合联合国条约对种族灭绝定义的战争罪。

;

;去年对乌克兰发动全面入侵并声称吞并了其约六分之一领土的莫斯科否认有任何犯罪行为，并表示它已经保护了战区的弱势儿童。

;

;返回卡塔尔官员表示，首批四名儿童中的一名正在测试海湾阿拉伯国家在与莫斯科和基辅进行数月秘密会谈后建立的系统。由于该过程的敏感性，该官员要求匿名。

;

;卡塔尔国际合作国务部长 Lolwah Al Khater 在一份声明中确认了调解，并将本周的遣返描述为“只是第一步”。

;

;俄罗斯儿童权利专员 Maria Lvova-Belova，该官员表示，卡塔尔外交官小组与卡塔尔外交官团队分享了一份简短的初步名单，该名单将被遣返，该小组核实了每个孩子的身份。

;

;目前尚不清楚俄罗斯将授权通过以下途径返回多少名儿童：该官员表示，继前四名儿童之后，卡塔尔机制将予以遣返。

;

;自 2022 年 2 月莫斯科入侵开始以来，已有约 400 名儿童被送回乌克兰，但联合国人权机构 ;上周提出了;的担忧，认为没有系统可以促进返回。

;

;该官员表示，前四名儿童“是第一批经过核实的儿童，（俄罗斯和乌克兰）同意他们找到了父母”。

;

;卡塔尔外交官将陪同这些儿童穿越爱沙尼亚、拉脱维亚或白俄罗斯边境这位官员表示，或者乘坐包机前往卡塔尔，然后将他们送回乌克兰。

;

;这位卡塔尔官员表示，“乌克兰和俄罗斯官员一直在合作”，并补充说乌克兰已与这个海湾阿拉伯国家进行了斡旋。俄罗斯比孩子更重要。

;

;卡塔尔是一个规模虽小但富有的能源强国，有着雄心勃勃的外交政策目标，最近因促成;美国与伊朗囚犯交换;以及在以色列和哈马斯武装分子之间就;可能释放在加沙扣押的以色列人质;。

;

;这位官员说，周五与祖母团聚的 7 岁男孩“因为战争爆发时与在俄罗斯的母亲失散”而在俄罗斯的一所儿童之家。;

;国际刑事法院（ICC）三月份对俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京和俄罗斯儿童事务专员利沃瓦-贝洛娃发出逮捕令，指控他们犯有从乌克兰非法驱逐儿童的战争罪。

;;2019 年 5 月 31 日，黎巴嫩贝鲁特，真主党成员在纪念圣城日（耶路撒冷日）的集会上举着党旗游行. REUTERS/Aziz Taher/File Photo;
;

;Lebanon's Hezbollah has been ;exchanging fire; with Israel across the border for days in the deadliest escalation since they fought a major war in 2006, threatening to expand a conflict between Israel and Palestinian group Hamas .

;

;Backed by Iran, Hezbollah has said it is ;ready to help; when the time comes in the war between Israel and Hamas, which is also backed by Tehran. ;Sources; said last week Hezbollah's attacks so far had been designed to be contained and so avoid another major war.

;

;Israel's ;defence minister; said on Oct. 15 that Israel had no interest in waging war on its northern front, and that if Hezbollah restrained itself then Israel would also keep the situation along the border as it is.

;

;Iran's Revolutionary Guards founded Hezbollah in 1982, the middle of Lebanon's 1975-90 civil war. It was part of Iran's effort to exports its 1979 Islamic Revolution around the region and fight Israeli forces after their 1982 invasion of Lebanon.

;

;Sharing Tehran's Shi'ite Islamist ideology, Hezbollah recruited Lebanese Shi'ite Muslims.

;

;The group has risen from a shadowy faction to a heavily armed force with major sway over the Lebanese state. The United States, some Western governments and others deem it a terrorist organisation.

;

;While other groups disarmed after Lebanon's civil war, Hezbollah kept its weapons to fight Israeli forces that were occupying the predominantly Shi'ite south of the country. Years of guerrilla warfare led Israel to withdraw in 2000.

;

;Hezbollah demonstrated its military advances in 2006 during a five-week war with Israel, which erupted after it crossed into Israel, kidnapping two soldiers and killing others.

;

;Hezbollah fired thousands of rockets into Israel during the conflict, in which 1,200 people were killed in Lebanon, mostly civilians, and 158 Israelis were killed, most of them soldiers.

;

;Hezbollah's military power grew after it deployed into Syria, another of Iran's allies in the region, to help President Bashar al-Assad fight mostly Sunni Muslim rebels.

;

;Hezbollah boasts weapons including precision rockets and drones, and says it can hit all parts of Israel. In 2021, Hezbollah leader Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah said the group had 100,000 fighters.

;

;Iran gives Hezbollah weapons and money. The United States estimates Iran has allocated it hundreds of millions of dollars annually in recent years.

;

;Hezbollah has deep ties to Hamas, which controls Gaza, and Islamic Jihad, another Palestinian faction backed by Iran.

;

;Hezbollah said it was in "direct contact with the leadership of the Palestinian resistance" on Oct. 7, the day Hamas militants carried out an unprecedented assault from Gaza into Israel, killing 1,300 people. In Israel's intensive ;air strikes; on Gaza in response, more than 2,750 people have been killed.

;

;Since Oct. 7, Hezbollah has exchanged cross-border fire with Israel numerous times. Hamas and Islamic Jihad, which both have a presence in Lebanon, have mounted attacks on Israel from Lebanon for the first time, including an Oct. 10 cross-border infiltration into Israel by Islamic Jihad.

;

;Tzachi Hanegbi, the national security adviser to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, said on Oct. 14 that the hostilities appeared to be restrained. Hanegbi warned Hezbollah not to take action that could lead to Lebanon's "destruction".

;

;Hezbollah has been a source of inspiration and support for other Iranian-backed groups across the Middle East. It has trained armed groups in Iraq and taken part in fighting there.

;

;Saudi Arabia says Hezbollah has also fought in support of the Iran-allied Houthis in Yemen. Hezbollah denies this.

;

;Hezbollah's influence is underpinned by its sophisticated arsenal and the support of many Lebanese Shi'ites who say the group defends Lebanon from Israel.

;

;Lebanese parties opposed to Hezbollah say the group has undermined the state and accuse it of unilaterally dragging Lebanon into armed conflicts.

;

;Hezbollah has ministers in government and lawmakers in parliament.

;

;It entered Lebanese politics more prominently in 2005 after Syria withdrew forces from Lebanon following the killing of former prime minister Rafik al-Hariri, who symbolised Saudi influence in the country.

;

;A UN-backed court convicted three Hezbollah members in absentia over the assassination. Hezbollah denies any role, describing the court as a tool of its enemies.

;

;In 2008, a power struggle between Hezbollah and its Lebanese political adversaries, who had the backing of the West and Saudi Arabia, spiralled into a brief conflict. Hezbollah fighters took over parts of Beirut after the government vowed to take action against the group's military communications network.

;

;In 2016, Hezbollah-allied Christian politician Michel Aoun became president - in Lebanon's sectarian political system the presidency is held by a Maronite Christian.

;

;Two years later, Hezbollah and its allies won a parliamentary majority. This majority was lost in 2022, but the group continued to exercise major political sway.

;

;The group campaigned against a judge investigating the 2020 Beirut port explosion, which devastated swathes of the capital, after he sought to question Hezbollah's allies. The standoff prompted deadly clashes in Beirut in 2021.

;

;Lebanese security officials and Western intelligence have said groups that were linked to Hezbollah carried out suicide attacks on Western embassies and targets and kidnapped Westerners in the 1980s. One group, Islamic Jihad, which is not related to the Palestinian organisation, was thought to be led by Imad Moughniyah, a top Hezbollah commander who was killed in a car bomb in Syria in 2008.

;

;The United States holds Hezbollah responsible for a suicide bombing that destroyed US Marine headquarters in Beirut in 1983, killing 241 servicemen, and a suicide attack the same year on the US embassy. A suicide bombing also hit a French barracks in Beirut in 1983, killing 58 French paratroopers.

;

;Referring to those attacks and hostage-taking, Hezbollah leader Nasrallah said in a 2022 interview that they were carried out by small groups not linked to Hezbollah.

;

;Western countries including the United States designate Hezbollah a terrorist organisation. So do US-allied Gulf Arab states including Saudi Arabia.

;

;The European Union classifies Hezbollah's military wing as a terrorist group, but not its political wing.

;

;Argentina blames Hezbollah and Iran for the 1994 bombing of a Jewish community centre in Buenos Aires in which 85 people were killed, and for a 1992 attack on the Israeli embassy in Buenos Aires that killed 29 people. Iran and Hezbollah both deny responsibility.

;An Indonesian court issued a ruling on Monday on the eligibility criteria for the country's top posts that will pave the way for the eldest son of outgoing leader Joko Widodo to run for vice president in next year's election.

;

;In a controversial decision that outraged critics of the president, the Constitutional Court ruled that candidates under the required age of 40 could seek the presidency or vice presidency in the Feb. 14 ballot, providing they have previously held elected regional office.

;

;The decision adds weight to speculation that Indonesia's president of nearly 10 years is moving to ;retain influence; by backing Defence Minister Prabowo Subianto as his successor, with his eldest son and a Surakarta city mayor Gibran Rakabuming Raka, 36, as running mate.

;

;Deciding on a petition that challenged the minimum age for running for the presidency and vice presidency, Judge M Guntur Hamzah said an age restriction would be an "injustice" against younger Indonesians with experience in government posts.

;

;"A minimum age of 40 not only hampers but hinders the development of the young generation," he said, noting leaders of France and New Zealand both rose to the top jobs in their 30s.

;

;The ruling just three days out from registration for the election could deepen concern about the perceived influence of Jokowi, as the president is popularly known, over Indonesia's democratic institutions, including his brother-in-law Anwar Usman's role as the court's chief justice.

;

;A court spokesperson did not immediately respond to a request for comment on Anwar's involvement in the ruling.

;

;Gibran has yet to publicly declare an intention to run for vice president and did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the court's decision.

;

;An entrenchment of patronage and dynastic politics would be at odds with the democratic reforms the world's third-largest democracy has achieved since the end of the rule of nepotistic strongman Suharto a quarter of a century ago, some analysts say.

;

;"The judicial institution has somewhat legalised dynastic politics in Indonesia," said Bivitri Susanti, of Indonesia's Jentera school of law.

;

;The hugely popular Jokowi, who is not allowed to run for a third term, is keen to preserve his legacy after ushering in a series of reforms and a major push to attract big-ticket investment to Southeast Asia's biggest economy.

;

;Prabowo, a former special forces commander and Jokovi's rival in presidential races in 2014 and 2019, is neck-and-neck in opinion polls for the top job with Central Java Governor Ganjar Pranowo, with ex-Jakarta governor Anies Baswedan a distant third.

;

;Jokowi has not formally backed Prabowo and last week ;brushed off; a question about whether he was seeking to create a political dynasty.

;

;In an opinion piece on Monday in the Jakarta Post published before the court ruling, Ary Hermawan, its editor at large said the court's decision could have a wide-reaching impact.

;

;"Concerns have been raised over whether the Constitutional Court can truly function as an impartial referee in the political race," Hermawan wrote.

;

;"We are entering uncharted territory here."
